snippet: North Carolina regulators say that under Gov. Pat McCrory, a weakened Department of Environment and Natural Resources has abandoned its regulatory role.
abstract: North Carolina regulators say that under Gov Pat McCrory, state's Department of Environmental and Natural Resources has abandoned its regulatory role and become deeply politicized; agency, once among the most aggressive watchdogs in the Southeast, attracted scrutiny for its lax relations with Duke Energy after utility spilled 39,000 tons of coal ash into the Dan River in early February.
lead_paragraph: North Carolina regulators say that under Gov. Pat McCrory, a weakened Department of Environment and Natural Resources has abandoned its regulatory role.

headline.main: Ash Spill Shows How Watchdog Was Defanged
headline.print_headline: Ash Spill Shows How Watchdog Was Defanged

keywords.value: Department of Environment and Natural Resources (NC)
keywords.name: organizations
